ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] A random eq tip, old for some, new for some.
ygData.msgSnippet: Oh cool! What lvl song is that? luv, -Su ... raid ... the ... druid ... in ... you ... http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
ygData.messageBody:
Oh cool! What lvl song is that?
luv,
-Su

> DA = Divine aura. you cant be killed and you cant attack, no spells land,
> cant cast any spells. Untouchable for about 18 secs.
>
> Only special attacks like deathtouches go through it, and it can be
> dispelled.
>
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Su [mailto:suceress@...]
> Sent: Thursday, January 31, 2002 9:44 PM
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] A random eq tip, old for some, new for some.
>
>
>
> Cool! I haven't participated in many raids yet, but that sounds like good
> advice. Thanks!
> What exactly does Kazumi's do?
> luv,
> -Su
>
> > As im mostly playing 60 bard heres a tip if you are low on wizzies on
raid
> > end and are having problems porting people out of a dungeon. This is old
> for
> > people in the raid a lot guilds and new for a few here maybe.
> >
> > Its the matter of druid's doing translocates.
> >
> > Heres the setup: It requires a 60 bard and a druid. Have the bard load
> > "Kazumi's note of preservation" (this is a group da song, 3 tick
> duration).
> > Instruct the druid to say when he starts casting his port spell, have
the
> > bard start Kazumi immediately after druid starts. Those that want to get
> > ported, click off the Kazumi's note effect icon (thus removing da),
druid
> > keeps it. All that removes da will be ported, rest will bounce and stay
in
> > zone.
> >
> > Rinse and repeat as many times needed to safely get all melees out.
> (Kazumi
> > has a little reload time)
> >
> > This will help a lot instead of having to bind/coth or whatever method
you
> > have to do to get enough porters.
> >
> > If you have any useful raiding tip - share it ;-)
> >
> > I figured it out for myself but im pretty sure others have found it out
> > aswell, should be on some messageboard I guess.
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > Visit the EverQuest homepage at http://www.everquest.com
> >

http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
